channel.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
channel.description: No one other than me can get on my serv for some reason, it just Dc's them, they log on and it just dcs them,two of my friends have tryed and it didnt work for either of them it just dc's them, please can you either tell me how to do it in a post or send me a guide link is something please

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @Evoked_Ko Evoked Ko
item.description:
@Evoked_Ko wrote:

wait so ummm.,…what should i do about it? lol

Read full topic

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

portforwarding is not the problem if he didn’t they wouldn’t even do anything they wuld try to connect and nothing would happen with portforwarding it allows them to connect to the computer and the server with out it nothing its not portforwarding

Read full topic
item.source: No one other than me can get on my Serv

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @i0b_0n i0b 0n
item.description:
@i0b_0n wrote:

NO portforward might be problem too, long time ago I didnt portforward too and only I could connect , and only after some time I found out that I forgot portforward. but if people connect to server , and then get kicked (dc) , then it’s not portforward 100%.

Read full topic
item.source: No one other than me can get on my Serv

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

raped by who:

From the sounds of it, he probably is losing packets on login.

More like you fail.

Also it might be bacuse there using a client that doesn’t suport your server or it could be a different type 317, 503, 508, 510, ect. they might now be using the right client for that type or server or your server has a UID blocker that dc’s people that don’t use that UID but i can tell you that portfarwarding is not your problem you can find the UID in the client.java of the server or it might be located in a differen place like the server.java idk

Read full topic
item.source: No one other than me can get on my Serv

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

You need to Portforward, which can be easily found out how to do in the Tutorial Section.

Read full topic
item.source: No one other than me can get on my Serv

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

Most UID’s I’ve heard of dont even allow you to connect to the server AT all.

Usually a login return message, telling them they need the official client.

Read full topic

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @i0b_0n i0b 0n
item.description:
@i0b_0n wrote:

If they dc then you have done portforward.
Something wrong with client you sended them , or server. Maybe they use diff client? and your client require currect UID. Well, I Don’t know. Try sending them your client or get another server&client . PS. IClarity ftw

Read full topic

item.title: No one other than me can get on my Serv
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

Its because you fail.

Buy a VPS, learn how to configure a client to fit with a server.
(or vice versa…)

Read full topic

item.description:

could be 2 reason
it could be the client there using if there is a certain one that goes with the server
or if might be portforwording but i dont think so since they log in your server but then gets connected but it could i never had to portforword
